speaker: Outstanding Multi-Camera Picture Editing for a Series
text: Ron Volk  ## Nominated  EMMY
nextSpeaker: Outstanding Writing for a Comedy Series

speaker: Outstanding Writing for a Comedy Series
text: Joe Keenan &  Christopher Lloyd
prevSpeaker: Outstanding Multi-Camera Picture Editing for a Series
nextSpeaker: Outstanding Guest Actor in a Comedy Series

speaker: Outstanding Guest Actor in a Comedy Series
text: Anthony LaPaglia  * * *  ## Cast List [_in order of appearance_]     FRASIER CRANE.........................................KELSEY GRAMMER    ANNE RANBERG..........................................JENNIFER BEALS    CHARLOTTE...............................................LAURA LINNEY    KENNY DALY...............................................TOM McGOWAN    ROZ DOYLE................................................PERI GILPIN    BEBE GLAZER....................................HARRIET SANSOM HARRIS    MARTIN CRANE............................................JOHN MAHONEY    RONEE LAWRENCE.........................................WENDIE MALICK    NILES CRANE........................................DAVID HYDE PIERCE    DAPHNE MOON CRANE........................................JANE LEEVES    SIMON MOON..........................................ANTHONY LaPAGLIA    MICHAEL MOON.........................................ROBBIE COLTRANE    STEPHEN MOON........................................RICHARD E. GRANT    CLINT....................................................MARK DEKLIN    ALICE MAY DOYLE........................................ASHLEY THOMAS    * * *  ## Transcript {Nick Hartley & Mike Lee}       [N.B. The transcript has not been divided cleanly in half, owing to  the extended length of the U.S. broadcast version.  So, Acts One  and Five have been transcribed by Nick Hartley, and Acts Two, Three  and Four by Mike Lee.]
prevSpeaker: Outstanding Writing for a Comedy Series

speaker: Skyline
text: A rainbow arcs out of the building line and touches the  first letter of the title.    _ACT ONE    Scene One -- An Airplane Cabin  A rather pensive Frasier Crane is sitting on a plane, looking out of  the window. It would seem the plane is going through some turbulence -  a jolt of which is especially felt by Anne, the young lady in black  sitting next to him._
prevSpeaker: Outstanding Guest Actor in a Comedy Series

speaker: Frasier
text: [_calmly_] You all right?  _Anne takes a deep sigh and turns to him, still pressing herself into  the seat._

speaker: Anne
text: [_embarrassed smile_] I hate flying.

speaker: Frasier
text: Just a little turbulence, we'll be through it in a minute.

speaker: Frasier
text: Mother of God!

speaker: Anne
text: This is so embarrassing.  I mean, I treat people for this.  I'm a psychiatrist.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, there's a small world, I'm a psychiatrist too.  [_putting out his hand:_] Dr. Frasier Crane.

speaker: Anne
text: Ooh, I've heard your show. [_returning the handshake:_] Dr.  Anne Ranberg.    [_N.B. Anne Ranberg is a blend of the names of two previous Frasier  writers; Anne Flett-Giordano and Chuck Ranberg._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Lovely to meet you.

speaker: Anne
text: Nice to meet you.  Now, don't let me interrupt you.  You  seemed kinda deep in thought.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, I suppose I was.  It's been a rather eventful three  weeks for me.

speaker: Anne
text: Well, if you want to talk about it, it might get our minds  off the flight.

speaker: Frasier
text: It's really rather personal... It's nothing you'd be  interested in.

speaker: Anne
text: [_accepting_] Okay, then.  _They sit back comfortably into silence but after another jolt of  turbulence..._

speaker: Frasier
text: So I was dating this woman...

speaker: Anne
text: Mmm-hmm...  _DISSOLVE TO:    Scene Two -- Frasier's Bedroom  The scene takes us back with Frasier's story.  Frasier and Charlotte  are wrapped in each other's arms in his bed.  They look perfectly  serene._

speaker: Charlotte
text: [_drowsily_] Weren't we on our way to lunch?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, but then you followed me in here when I came to get  my briefcase and uttered the fatal phrase that no man can  resist.

speaker: Charlotte
text: [_laughing_] I said I liked your pillow shams.

speaker: Frasier
text: Nice try, my little temptress, but I'm down for at least  an hour.

speaker: Charlotte
text: [_laughs and caresses his face_] Do you still have time for  lunch before work?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, my show doesn't start till two, and it's only...  _Frasier looks at the clock to see how many more Frasier hours  Charlotte will be able to clock up._

speaker: Frasier
text: [_jumps up in bed_] Oh dear God!    _It is two o'clock.    SMASH CUT TO: Radio Station  Roz is stressing on the phone as an even more anxious Kenny bursts  in._

speaker: Kenny
text: Where the hell is he?

speaker: Roz
text: I don't know. [_hanging up_] I called his cell, I called his  house... You're going to have to go on for him.

speaker: Kenny
text: Me?!

speaker: Roz
text: Yeah, you -- well, I'm not.  Last time I did it, it was a  total disaster!    [_N.B. An obvious reference to[[10.02]](/frasier/transcripts/season_10/episode_2/enemy_at_the_gate.html "Enemy At The Gate") "Enemy at the Gate," when an  overconfident Roz took over Frasier's show, and ended up letting  slip over the air that she and Frasier had slept together._]

speaker: Roz
text: Aren't you always saying you used to be a DJ?

speaker: Kenny
text: Oh, twenty years ago, I can't do that anymore!

speaker: Roz
text: Well, it better come back to you, you've got five seconds.

speaker: Kenny
text: I can't!  I'm a nervous wreck!  My palms are sweaty, my  mouth is like cotton...  _Roz directs him to the microphone and instantly Kenny becomes a  hideous D.J. monster with a voice sounding like the voice-over  narrator on movie trailers after a bad dose of helium._

speaker: Kenny
text: Hey, Emerald City, Kenny Daly heerrre!  Master of the Mike,  Baron of the Booth, the Man of the Hour, too sweet to be  sourrrr! [_puts on headphones_] The doctor's ouuuut today,  but Kenny's heerrre - filling the seat, takin' the heat!  I might even throw in a call or two to Grandma Gert.  [_typical old lady's voice:_] But no kids, I hate kids!  [_back to the voice of D.J. Daly Hell_] Whoo-hoo, she's in  a mood today!  _Kenny looks up at an unbelieving Roz.  However, he fails to translate  the signals being made by her boggling eyes, and just grins.    CUT TO: Frasier's Bedroom  Meanwhile, back in the bedroom... Charlotte is listening to Kenny's  ramblings as Frasier dresses in the bathroom._

speaker: Kenny
text: [_v.o. from the radio:_] Who's this coming into the booth?  Why, it's Percy Von Snootenheim!

speaker: Frasier
text: [_o.s. from the bathroom_] Turn that off!  _Charlotte complies as Frasier comes out of the bathroom dressed for  work._

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm sorry I have to rush off.  I wish we could spend the  whole day together. [_leans in to kiss Charlotte_]

speaker: Charlotte
text: I don't leave for Chicago until midnight.  I'll, I'll  come over and make you dinner.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh that sounds great, I'd love that.

speaker: Charlotte
text: Any requests?

speaker: Frasier
text: Uh... I liked what I had for lunch.

speaker: Charlotte
text: [_blushing_] Why don't I just surprise you?

speaker: Frasier
text: Still sounding like lunch.  _He laughs and leans in to kiss her again.    CUT TO: Radio Station  Back in the studio, Roz's mind begins to shut down as she listens  to Kenny embarrass himself further.  He is sat with his feet on the  console, and the microphone in his hands._

speaker: Kenny
text: Isn't that a great song, people?  Really brings back the  memories.  Sorry I kinda forgot the words there in the  middle.  So let's toss it to the news! [_clicks a button  with vigor_]

speaker: Roz
text: Where the hell have you been?

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm sorry, I am sorry.  I had a doctor's appointment, it  couldn't be helped!  _Frasier enters the presenter's booth and relieves Kenny of his  duties._

speaker: Kenny
text: Just in time, Doc.  This turned out to be one of your  better shows.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well thank you, Kenny.  _Frasier sits in worry to find his angst rising when an old friend  suddenly appears in the booth.  Behold, the return of Special Agent  Bebe Glazer -- licensed to make you a star!_

speaker: Bebe
text: Darling!

speaker: Frasier
text: Bebe?!  What are you doing here?

speaker: Bebe
text: [_flinging her arms around him_] I just came by to see my  favorite client, [_kisses him on the cheek, then turns to  Kenny_] and the wonderful man who's giving him such a  happy, happy home.

speaker: Kenny
text: Ah, you're the best, Bebe!  _Bebe smiles as she shuts the door on him, and then in a heartbeat  turns to Frasier and says:_

speaker: Bebe
text: Good news, I'm busting you out of this hellhole!

speaker: Frasier
text: What?!

speaker: Bebe
text: Did you ever hear of Dr. Mark Reisman?    [_N.B. Mark Reisman is a reference to a man of the same name who  previously worked on "Frasier" as a producer._]

speaker: Frasier
text: The San Francisco radio psychiatrist?  Yes, we had a nice  encounter once at a conference.

speaker: Bebe
text: Well, last week he had a not-so-nice encounter with a  falling air conditioner.  _She sticks her tongue out and gestures to her throat as if to slit  it._

speaker: Bebe
text: Anyway, they want you to replace him and the money's huge!

speaker: Frasier
text: Poor Mark... what a ghastly way to die!

speaker: Bebe
text: Yes, I cried so hard it was all I could do to stuff your  demo tape in the Fed-Ex pouch.  But they want you!

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, it's very tempting, Bebe, but I'm very happy here in  Seattle.  I don't want to leave.

speaker: Bebe
text: Darling, it's San Francisco!  Do you know what life is like  there for a good-looking straight man?  You'll be like a  Snickers bar at a fat camp!  _She knows just what to say to tempt him mightily.  He considers it  for a moment, then..._

speaker: Frasier
text: [_resisting the Bebe temptation_] Uhhh... No.  My answer is  still no, Bebe.  I've got to begin my show. [_sits down_]

speaker: Bebe
text: Well, that's gratitude for ya!  Do you have any idea the  lengths I went to to make this happen? [_opens the door_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Wait a minute.  You were in San Francisco last week.  Don't  tell me...!

speaker: Bebe
text: I was nowhere near that air conditioner. [_teasing:_] You're  worse than the police.  _Bebe giggles like the Devil and leaves Dr. Faust-ier without his  soul.    FADE OUT_    **THE GULFS MAY WASH  US DOWN**    _Scene Three -- Frasier's Apartment - Kitchen  We are presented with a visual image of Charlotte's opening line:  her cooking at the stove, Frasier behind her with his arm wrapped  around her waist, nuzzling her affectionately.  _

speaker: Charlotte
text: We are such a cliche!  Little woman at the stove, big  rugged man with his brawny arm...

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, the hollandaise is breaking!  _As she turns her attention to the imperilled sauce, Frasier removes  his brawny arm and enters the living room, carrying a bottle of  wine.    Reset to: Living Room  The table is set for two.  Martin, dressed in his suit, enters from  his bedroom._

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad, I thought you were going out with Niles and Daphne?

speaker: Martin
text: I'm waiting on Ronee.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, well, Charlotte is leaving for Chicago in three hours.  This is our farewell dinner.

speaker: Charlotte
text: Oh, hi Martin.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, hi, how are ya?  Don't worry, we're leaving.  I'm not  going to spoil your romantic mood. [_shouts down the  hallway:_] Hey, Ronee, what, did you fall in?!

speaker: Frasier
text: Good heavens, I thought that you were meeting them  downstairs.

speaker: Martin
text: [_heading to the door_] That's what I thought too.

speaker: Kenny
text: Hey, Martin.  Oh, thank God you're home, Doc.  I'm going a  little crazy, I need some advice.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_trying to excuse him_] Kenny, we just put dinner on the  table.

speaker: Kenny
text: Oh thanks but I'm too worked up to eat.  Doing your show  today, I... I got the fever! I want to get back behind the  mike.  But should I quit my job, throw away my whole career  and financial security just to chase some cock-a-mamie  dream?!

speaker: Frasier
text: [_with a big smile_] Yes!  Off you go!

speaker: Kenny
text: You didn't even have to think about it!  You always  believed in me, Doc!  _Kenny throws his arms around Frasier in a zealous hug.  He suddenly  spots Charlotte and, whilst still hugging Frasier, holds out his  hand._

speaker: Kenny
text: Hi.  Kenny Daly.

speaker: Charlotte
text: [_shakes hand_] Hi, nice to meet you.

speaker: Frasier
text: This is Charlotte.

speaker: Kenny
text: [_welling up_] I'm getting all messy here.  Let me just pop  into the powder room real fast.  _Kenny leaves to the powder room as Martin shouts back down the  hallway._

speaker: Martin
text: Ronee!  While we're young!

speaker: Ronee
text: [_enters_] Too late! [_to Frasier_] Well, have a great evening,  you two.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, thank you.  Bye.

speaker: Ronee
text: Oh damn it, my contact slipped, hang on.

speaker: Kenny
text: [_o.s. from the bathroom_] Whoa!

speaker: Ronee
text: Whoa yourself. [_closes door_] Do we know him?  _The front door opens revealing the terrible twosome... nearly  threesome._

speaker: Niles
text: Knock-knock.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, for God's sake!

speaker: Niles
text: Now, I know it's your special night but my very pregnant  wife insisted we come up.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_holding up her hands, pushing her legs together_] Oh sorry,  won't be a minute.

speaker: Kenny
text: [_o.s. from the bathroom_] Whoa!

speaker: Daphne
text: [_closes the door_] Oh, sorry!  I'll just run down the  hall.

speaker: Charlotte
text: Maybe I'll start over on that dinner.  _Daphne leaves as Charlotte excuses herself to the kitchen.  Martin,  Niles, and Ronee, to Frasier's great frustration, sit down to wait  for Daphne._

speaker: Niles
text: I'm sorry for intruding, but nowadays Daphne can't go ten  minutes... we're late for everything.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, well, you know how Chez Henri hates it when people are  Late, so I tell you what, why don't we call for that  elevator right now...

speaker: Frasier
text: And tell Henri that the first round of drinks is on me!  _Frasier opens the door to find another surprise.  A drunken  surprise.  Of English heritage._

speaker: Simon
text: Whiskey, please!

speaker: Frasier
text: Simon?!

speaker: Simon
text: Oh Frasier, how are ya? [_greets Frasier with a hug_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Please leave immediately.

speaker: Simon
text: Hey!  Oh, there's my little sister.  You're not so little  any more now, are you? [_he advances to her pregnant bump_]

speaker: Daphne
text: [_stands back from the drunk smell_] Simon, what are you  doing here?

speaker: Simon
text: Well I heard you was knocked up so I, er, brought you a  present.  Come on in, lads!  _Richard E. Grant and Robbie Coltrane enter... um, sorry, I mean  Daphne's brothers, Michael and Stephen Moon, enter from the hallway.  Daphne greets them with excitement.  Frasier and Niles greet them  with immediate concern._

speaker: Michael
text: Hello, sis!

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh my God, Michael! [_hugs him_] And Stephen! [_hugs him_]

speaker: Simon
text: We knew you'd be here when we went to your house and you  wasn't there.

speaker: Stephen
text: So we took the liberty of leaving our things in your guest  room.

speaker: Niles
text: How did you get in?

speaker: Michael
text: [_mumbled, pointing at Niles_] How did we...  _They burst out into a fit of boisterous laughter.    It should be noted that all of Michael's speech is mumbled, which  combined with his thick accent makes his speech very hard to  understand.  Think of the character of Joseph in "Wuthering Heights"  and move west over the Pennines.    I must say, Coltrane's attempt at the Mancunian accent is easily the  best seen so far on the show.  Interestingly, he is also a Scot in  reality, just like Brian Cox, who played Daphne's father, Harry.  --Nick Hartley_    [_N.B. Think also of Brad Pitt's character in Guy Ritchie's "Snatch."  However, I notice that Nick is uniquely qualified to make some sense  of it.  The American transcribers doing the closed captioning for  the episode simply wrote, "unintelligible gibberish." --Mike Lee_]

speaker: Daphne
text: Stephen and Michael, this is my husband, Niles. [_hand  shakes occur_] Oh and his brother, Frasier.  And this is  Martin and his fiancee Ronee.  And, er, [_looking over at  the previous occupant of the bathroom_] sorry, your name  again?

speaker: Kenny
text: Kenny.

speaker: Daphne
text: Kenny.

speaker: Michael
text: So, lads, I tell you what... [_mumbling_] You've a lovely  �ouse. [_motioning around the room_] It's come rhand thee're,  rhand thee're... [_mumbling unintelligibly_] he's done bloody  well for himself.

speaker: Simon
text: That's right, Michael.  Frasier does very well for himself.  Tell you what, let's take the tour.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_hands up_] There will be no tours!

speaker: Martin
text: Listen, uh, why don't you guys join us for dinner?

speaker: Stephen
text: Good, I'll lay the table. [_picks up cutlery_] Is this real  silver? [_attempts to bend it_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Give me that! [_takes it off of him_]  _Michael, meanwhile, is man-handling Frasier's Chihuly glass  sculpture._

speaker: Michael
text: Oh, wow, see, platey, platey, platey... [_mumbling  unintelligibly_] It's a bloody great ash tray.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_shrieks in terror_] Put that down!   [_N.B. Since the Chihuly is genuine and valued at upwards of $75,000,  what Robbie Coltrane and Kelsey Grammer are juggling may well be a  replica._]  _CUT TO: Kitchen  Meanwhile, in the kitchen, Charlotte is back cooking at the stove,  smiling happily - unaware that Simon is the man fondling her from  behind._

speaker: Charlotte
text: [_teasing:_] You know, we could have some real fun if you  got rid of some of those people.

speaker: Simon
text: Oh, just give us a minute then, love...  _Charlotte screams and runs into the lounge.  Simon follows.    Reset to: Living Room  Frasier runs over to catch Charlotte coming out._

speaker: Charlotte
text: Who is that creep?

speaker: Simon
text: You know, I'm getting some very mixed signals.

speaker: Frasier
text: All right, that's it!  I want you all out of here! [_pushing  Simon_] And I do not mean a leisurely exit, I mean a  break-neck, trampling-each-other, this-theatre's-on-fire  stampede!

speaker: Simon
text: Yeah, all right, okay, I can take a hint, Frasier!  Right.  Look, that's a lovely woman that you've got for yourself.  Congratulations.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, thank you.

speaker: Simon
text: Yeah, yeah. [_looks over Frasier's shoulder at Charlotte and  gestures to her_] Give us a call, I'll be at Daphne's...

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, get out of here!  _Frasier pushes him out and finally slams the door on them for the  peace with Charlotte he desired.    DISSOLVE TO:    Scene Four -- Apartment, three hours later.  Frasier and Charlotte are finishing up their final game of Scrabble.  _

speaker: Frasier
text: Because it's not a word.

speaker: Charlotte
text: Yes, it is.

speaker: Frasier
text: No, it's not.

speaker: Charlotte
text: Yes, it is.

speaker: Frasier
text: Use it in a sentence.

speaker: Charlotte
text: "Her grandmother's bed was warm and... quilty."

speaker: Frasier
text: [_looking at another of her words_] And why is she lying  there?  Because she's feeling all "befevered" again?

speaker: Charlotte
text: [_smiling sweetly_] Could I borrow your "F"? I've got a  little message for you.

speaker: Charlotte
text: Hello.  Okay, thanks. [_hangs up_] My car's here.       [_N.B. In Laura Linney's recent film, "Love Actually" the trademark  of her character was a stubborn refusal to turn her mobile off, no  matter how many times it rang at just the right moment to kill  romance._]

speaker: Frasier
text: I still don't know why you won't let me drive you to the  airport.

speaker: Charlotte
text: No, I can't stand all that airport goodbye stuff.  This  is better. [_goes to gather her belongings_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Right.  Uh, well then...

speaker: Charlotte
text: Let's not...

speaker: Frasier
text: ...right.

speaker: Charlotte
text: [_tearing up_] Because if you start...

speaker: Frasier
text: Yeah.  Me too.  Okay.  Well then, uh, good luck in  Chicago.  _Charlotte and Frasier look into each other's eyes.  Frasier is in  the middle of yet another goodbye.  They hug dearly._

speaker: Charlotte
text: Thanks.

speaker: Frasier
text: Got your ticket?

speaker: Charlotte
text: [_looks in bag_] Uh, yeah.

speaker: Frasier
text: Great, great.  Oh, oh, [_darts to set of drawers next to  toilet_] listen, I have a little something here for you.

speaker: Charlotte
text: Damn it.  I knew you were going to do something sweet  like that.  I didn't get you anything.

speaker: Frasier
text: It's just a hair band I found in the shower drain.

speaker: Charlotte
text: Thanks.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yeah. [_chuckles_] Uh, let me get your coat. [_he does_]

speaker: Charlotte
text: This wasn't supposed to be so hard.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_helping her on with her coat_] I don't know about you,  but I've had enough easy goodbyes.  I'm kinda glad to  have the chance to have another tough one.

speaker: Charlotte
text: [_putting her hand in his_] Thank you for a great three  weeks.

speaker: Frasier
text: Bye, Charlotte.

speaker: Charlotte
text: Bye, Frasier.  _She leaves.  Frasier looks back at his empty apartment and begins to  slowly walk back to the sofa.  He is stopped by a knock on the door.  He opens it to find Charlotte back again._

speaker: Charlotte
text: Forgot my scarf!

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh.  Oh, my fault.

speaker: Frasier
text: Right.

speaker: Frasier
text: Bye.

speaker: Charlotte
text: Yeah.  _She leaves.  Frasier looks back again at his once more empty  apartment and begins to slowly walk back to the sofa only to  find another, albeit similar, interruption.  He opens the door  again..._

speaker: Charlotte
text: Cell phone.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh.  Yes.  Yes.  Oh, here.  _Frasier goes round the room to take the cell phone off of the table.  Charlotte chooses a different route.  They make a move at the same  times and bang their heads together._

speaker: Both
text: Ow!

speaker: Frasier
text: Sorry.

speaker: Charlotte
text: No, it's my fault.

speaker: Frasier
text: My word.  Ah....

speaker: Charlotte
text: See ya.

speaker: Frasier
text: See ya.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh for God's sake, what now?  _He opens the door and finds Charlotte open-armed.  They hug  passionately._

speaker: Charlotte
text: We couldn't say goodbye on a head butt.

speaker: Charlotte
text: Feel better?

speaker: Frasier
text: Positively quilty.    _They part.  For real.    FADE OUT    END OF ACT ONE    ACT TWO_    _Scene Five -- Apartment  The next morning.  Martin opens the door to Niles, carrying a shopping  bag.  _

speaker: Martin
text: Oh hey, Niles.

speaker: Niles
text: Hey, Dad.

speaker: Martin
text: What are you doing here?

speaker: Niles
text: Escaping.  I woke this morning to find Daphne's brothers  playing a game called "I Can Reach It From Here."  Give you  a hint, the "It" was a toilet.  And there were no winners.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, also I stopped by to see how Frasier's holding up.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, he was asleep when I got home, and he's still in bed.

speaker: Niles
text: He's probably depressed.  I'm sure this whole Charlotte thing  has got him bereft...

speaker: Martin
text: Ooh, shh, shh!  _Frasier has entered -- looking rested and serene.  _

speaker: Frasier
text: Morning, Dad.  Hey, Niles.

speaker: Martin
text: Let me get you a cup of coffee. [_goes to the kitchen_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I can get it.

speaker: Niles
text: [_takes out a bag_] I brought you some of those cookies you  like.

speaker: Frasier
text: Milanos!  Oh, well thank you.

speaker: Martin
text: Now you just sit down, I made you a little breakfast.

speaker: Frasier
text: I see what's going on.  You think I'm in tatters because  Charlotte's gone back to Chicago.  Well, I'm not. [_sits down_]  I'm not going to say I won't miss her like crazy.  But we knew  going in that our time was limited.  We made the most of it.  I have no regrets.

speaker: Simon
text: Morning!

speaker: Frasier
text: Except for leaving that door unlocked.

speaker: Daphne
text: We thought you might like to join us for brunch.

speaker: Frasier
text: Darn! ...Niles and I just reserved a squash court.

speaker: Niles
text: Yes!  And we're on thin ice with the appointments director as  it is.  He's already moved our lockers next to the flip-flop  drop.  _Simon has already flopped down onto the couch.  Daphne lowers herself  into Martin's chair._

speaker: Michael
text: [_mumbling unintelligibly, gesturing around the apartment_]  ... this whole place... [_mumbling_]

speaker: Simon
text: That's right, Michael, Frasier has a very nice flat.  But you  was here last night.

speaker: Michael
text: ...Was I?

speaker: Daphne
text: I think I need to sit down a minute before we go. [_sinks into  Martin's chair_] Can you believe this baby might be two weeks  late?

speaker: Stephen
text: [_patting her belly_] He's a Moon, all right!  Every lad in  our family was at least two weeks late.  Once we get comfy,  nothing budges us.  Right, lads?

speaker: Simon/Michael
text: Right!

speaker: Daphne
text: Could I get a glass of water, please?

speaker: Niles
text: Glass of water, yes. [_motions toward kitchen_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Right, right...

speaker: Michael
text: Oh, Fras-or?  Be a good lad... [_mumbling, miming the shape of  a can with his hands_] nice big... [_mumbling_] Right, lads?

speaker: Michael
text: [_holding up four fingers_] Three!  _Frasier and Niles, at a loss, go into the kitchen.    Reset to: Kitchen  Frasier gets Daphne's water while Niles removes some kind of electronic  device from the shopping bag he's carrying._

speaker: Frasier
text: Do you have any idea what he's saying?

speaker: Niles
text: Not a word.  Apparently Stephen was dropped as a child.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I thought the mumbler was Michael.

speaker: Niles
text: He was dropped on Michael.  The idea that our son might take  after them is making me crazy!

speaker: Frasier
text: Now Niles, just remember, those hearty Crane genes are in  there too.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, please.  Those Moon genes have probably beaten our genes  up and stolen their lunch money!  That is why I am taking  action.  I was going to wait to do this until tonight, but I  can see that every minute is critical.

speaker: Frasier
text: What's this?

speaker: Niles
text: This is called "The Born Musician."  You put this speaker on  the mother's stomach, and it bombards the baby with classical  music, thus instilling a taste for higher culture.

speaker: Frasier
text: Huh.  Closest thing we had to that was Dad bongo-ing out  "Babalu" on Mom's belly.  _They go back out.    Reset to: Living Room  Daphne is admiring a new watch on her wrist as Stephen looks on._

speaker: Frasier
text: Here we are.

speaker: Daphne
text: Niles, look what Stephen just gave me.  You know who'll be  jealous?  Mrs. Zicklin from our building.  Doesn't she have  one just like this?

speaker: Niles
text: [_knowingly_] No, I don't think she does.  _He exchanges a look with Stephen, who grins and swaggers back to  the couch._

speaker: Niles
text: I brought you a present too.  This plays soothing music  for the baby.  You put this speaker here [_places it on  her stomach_] just like that, and then if you want to hear  a selection of, say - oh, I don't know, Vivaldi? -- you turn  this dial, and then...  _As Simon and Stephen sit up with interest, the baby kicks, knocking  the speaker to the floor._

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, goodness!  He's never kicked like that before.

speaker: Stephen
text: We've got a little foot-baller in there!

speaker: Simon
text: Finally we got something we can drink to!

speaker: Michael
text: Well, let's go to the pub!

speaker: Stephen/Simon
text: YEAH!

speaker: Simon/Michael/Stephen
text: [_singing_] We hate Nottingham Forest, we hate  Liverpool too...

speaker: Simon
text: And Leeds!

speaker: Simon/Michael/Stephen
text: We hate Manchester City...

speaker: Daphne
text: Are you coming, Martin?

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, I'm still waiting on Ronee.  We'll meet you at the  restaurant.

speaker: Daphne
text: Okay.

speaker: Ronee
text: Marty?

speaker: Martin
text: Hmm?

speaker: Ronee
text: I just got off the phone with the Branford Inn.  They called  to confirm our wedding reservation -- for May 15th.

speaker: Martin
text: But we're getting married July 15th.

speaker: Ronee
text: Yes, but they have us down for May.  Apparently July 15th  is booked, along with every other weekend between now and  October.

speaker: Martin
text: What happened?

speaker: Ronee
text: I don't know, you made the reservation.

speaker: Martin
text: For July 15th! [_to the boys_] Well, I love how she blames me!

speaker: Martin
text: Why would I randomly pick a...? [_realizes_] Oh, no.

speaker: Frasier
text: What?

speaker: Martin
text: May 15th -- Eddie's birthday.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, I'm-I'm sure you can find someplace else.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, but we had our hearts set on the Branford Inn.  It's where  we had our second date.

speaker: Ronee
text: Yeah, we had a little too much wine, and the couple at the  next table said "get a room," and so we did.  Oh, well,  guess we better start thinking about Plan B.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, damn.  Well, I just feel sorry for Ronee.  You know, her  first wedding was kind of bare-boned, and that's why she had  her heart set on something special.  You know, a fancy menu,  swing band, flowers everywhere.  You need that once in your  life.  _While he has been saying this, Frasier and Niles have been exchanging  looks with growing delight._

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, Dad... Niles and I have been wondering what to get  you for your wedding, and... maybe we could just give you the  wedding.

speaker: Niles
text: You still have the Branford Inn on the 15th.

speaker: Martin
text: But that's, that's eight days away!  You have to get a  caterer, a justice of the peace...

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I can officiate.  I still have my license from that time  I married those commitment-phobes on my Valentine's Day show.

speaker: Niles
text: Are they still together?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_raises a hand_] Not the time, Niles.

speaker: Martin
text: Ronee, the boys think they can throw a fancy wedding together  by May 15th.

speaker: Ronee
text: But that's in eight days!

speaker: Niles
text: Well, it only took us four days to throw together our seafood-  themed "Friends of the Marina Bouilla-bash."

speaker: Ronee
text: Well, all right, that-that's great of you guys, thank you!

speaker: Martin
text: Wow, what do you know?

speaker: Ronee
text: Yeah, leave it to the Duke and Duchess to save our behinds!

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah...

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm sorry, leave it to whom?

speaker: Ronee
text: What, they don't know about that one?

speaker: Martin
text: Just keep walking.

speaker: Both
text: [_pointing_] Well, obviously you're the duchess...  _They start arguing hotly.    FADE TO:_  **THE HAPPY ISLES**  _Scene Six -- The Branford Inn  Jazz music is heard playing.  The scene fades in on the dining room of  the Branford inn, which has been sumptuously prepared.  Caterers are  still rushing about the room.  Champagne and hors d'oeuvres have been  laid on a buffet table, flowers adorn the windows -- the whole nine  yards.    As the scene fades in, Frasier, wearing a morning suit, claps his hands  and halts a group of dancers who have been rehearsing a swing routine.  The male dancers are dressed like cops, the female dancers like  showgirls.  The music stops.  _

speaker: Frasier
text: Dancers, rehearsal is over.  Please wait upstairs.  I don't  want anyone to see you until the floor show.  _The dancers exit.  A guest taps on the glass door leading outside,  rather urgently.  Frasier runs over and cracks the door._

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm sorry, we're still setting up.  _He closes the door in the man's face and addresses Clint, the Inn's  host._

speaker: Frasier
text: Clint, would you please go outside and tell everyone they  can't come in here until after the ceremony.  It will spoil  the entire reveal.

speaker: Niles
text: You can't blame them, it's ninety degrees out there.  It's  dripping wet- [_realizes_] I hope our Chinese acrobats are  sufficiently rosined.

speaker: Martin
text: Holy Mackerel!

speaker: Ronee
text: You guys are amazing!

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I'm glad you like it, you two, but listen, you've gotta  go get changed, you're getting married in ten minutes.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh yeah, sorry, traffic was bad.  We got stuck behind this old  bus.  A church group, I think.

speaker: Frasier
text: Good, our gospel choir is here!  Niles, go make sure they're  fitted with their angel wings and give them all a meal  voucher!

speaker: Roz
text: Frasier!

speaker: Frasier
text: Roz, I'm sorry, I can't let you in, I know it's warm out  there.  I'll tell you what, go have a cool drink with Kenny.

speaker: Roz
text: I just did, he told me all about his new D.J. job.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, well good for him!  I'll come down and give him a hug.

speaker: Roz
text: Well, bring a towel, he just sweated through a hammock.  This sucks!  The softest boss we ever had is leaving.  Come on, Frasier, let me in.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, all right, Roz.  I can't say I blame you, it's like the  Ninth Circle of Hell out there!

speaker: Bebe
text: Do you love this weather or what?

speaker: Frasier
text: Bebe!  What are you doing here?

speaker: Bebe
text: Your strategy worked, you genius.

speaker: Frasier
text: What strategy?

speaker: Bebe
text: Turning down the San Francisco job.  They've offered you  twenty percent more money, and thrown in a weekly TV gig  on the morning news.

speaker: Frasier
text: Television... well, that certainly sounds tempting, but, but  my home is here!  There are more important things than money!

speaker: Bebe
text: Yes, I know.  There's power.  But money can buy that.

speaker: Frasier
text: Bebe!

speaker: Bebe
text: Fine!

speaker: Bebe
text: You don't like the terms of the deal, I'll have another swing  at it. [_looks out_] Did that old man just faint?

speaker: Frasier
text: What? [_runs out beside her_] Oh, good lord!  That's my cannon  operator!  At the end of the ceremony, he's supposed to fire  that antique cannon.  I'm not sure there's anybody else who  knows how to work the damn thing.  Oh...

speaker: Niles
text: Frasier...!

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles...!

speaker: Both
text: Disaster!

speaker: Niles
text: Dear God, you first.

speaker: Frasier
text: Our cannon man is down -- heatstroke.

speaker: Niles
text: Our flower girl is down -- drunk.

speaker: Frasier
text: The flower girl?!

speaker: Niles
text: Apparently someone gave her champagne.

speaker: Frasier
text: Who would give liquor to a six-year-old girl?  _He had to ask? - Simon, Michael, and Stephen enter in their suits,  with cigarettes and glasses of champagne._

speaker: Simon
text: Party's here, lads.

speaker: Frasier
text: Simon!  Did you give our flower girl champagne?

speaker: Simon
text: I may have. [_off Frasier's glare_] Well, the poor little thing  was nervous about getting her part right.

speaker: Michael
text: Nervous.  _Daphne enters, leading Eddie wearing a little tuxedo and a lacey  cushion strapped to his back._

speaker: Daphne
text: Here's our little ring-bearer.  Ronee will be down in two  minutes.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, great!  Still no flower girl, and now no one to fire our  cannon!

speaker: Michael
text: [_looks up_] Cannon?

speaker: Stephen
text: If it's a cannon you need fired, Michael's your man.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh yeah, he's a great one for shooting things.  Which foot is  it that's missing two toes?

speaker: Michael
text: Um... [_looks from one foot to another, then points to Simon's_]  That one!   [_N.B. Michael, of course, lost at least one toe to frostbite as a child --  after his brothers rolled him across thin ice on a frozen lake.  He'd  be missing more if his family hadn't stopped him from sawing off the  rest of them.  For the full story, read [[6.19]](/frasier/transcripts/season_6/episode_19/iq.html "IQ") "IQ."_]

speaker: Frasier
text: All right then, come along, all of you.  See if you can figure  out this thing.

speaker: Frasier
text: Now your cue to fire it is when I say, at the end of the  ceremony, "ladies and gentlemen, Mr. and Mrs. Martin Crane."  You got it?

speaker: Michael
text: Right... [_mumbles unintelligibly at length_]... Boom!

speaker: Niles
text: Is Eddie growling?

speaker: Daphne
text: It's his stomach.  The poor thing hasn't eaten since morning.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, for God's sakes, we can't have him rumbling up the aisle.  Uh, give him some of that pate over there.  _As Daphne and Niles lead Eddie to the buffet table, Roz enters with  Alice._

speaker: Frasier
text: Ooh, Roz!  Do you think that we could enlist Alice to be our  flower girl?

speaker: Roz
text: What do you say, honey?

speaker: Alice
text: Sure!

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, that's splendid news!  Here, here, take these rose petals.  [_gives her a basket_] You're supposed to strew them in the  aisle as you lead the procession in and out.

speaker: Niles
text: You know what, I guess I'd better give our ring-bearer his  precious cargo.  _Frasier sends Roz and Alice outside and shouts after them as Niles  spoons some pate into a little dish and puts it on the floor.  Niles  takes the ring out and lowers it to the basket..._

speaker: Frasier
text: Roz, her cue to lead the procession out at the end of the  ceremony is when I say, "ladies and gentlemen, Mr. and Mrs.  Martin Crane!"  _BOOM!  Screams come from the guests outside, and Frasier jumps.  Inside, Niles jumps higher, sending the ring flying up into the  air._

speaker: Frasier
text: NOT NOW!  _His nerves nearly shot, he closes the door, exhaling -- then from  outside comes the sound of tires squealing, a horn blaring, and a  very heavy THUD.  _

speaker: Frasier
text: [_Walter Matthau_] What the hell was that?!  _He runs out of the dining room, through to another exit.  Daphne  notices Niles peering around the floor._

speaker: Daphne
text: What are you looking for?

speaker: Niles
text: The ring.  I dropped it when that cannon-

speaker: Daphne
text: [_sees it_] It's in the pate!  Eddie, no!  _Too late.  Eddie has scarfed the pate and swallowed the ring.    Frasier runs back in._

speaker: Frasier
text: This is just our luck!  When the gun went off, it startled  a truck driver, he slammed into a lamppost.  Now the entire  roadway is blocked!  Can anything else go wrong at this  wedding?

speaker: Frasier
text: What?  _FADE OUT    END OF ACT TWO_
